intro: Higginsia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf higginsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the western United States and parts of Mexico, typically found in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Higginsia latifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
